title: The Importance of Being Seven
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Dilly wondered what the implications of being in that particular field would be. For a moment she pictured the field at Myreside, where Watsonians played rugby. Would it be dangerous for a researcher to position himself on the edge of that field?

title: Sunshine on Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Bruce said that he did not believe in going much faster than that, which was convenient, as he had bought the car cheaply and that was its maximum speed. "It's irresponsible," Bruce opined in the rugby club bar at Myreside, "to go more than eighty-five. Speed limits are there for a purpose, you know."
